summary.p: [1] In 25 points, Frölich considers the reasons why the council of Augsburg should not oppose Emperor Charles V, and what problems would arise for Augsburg if the city did not come to an understanding with the Emperor like Ulm and other cities. This enumeration is concluded with a remark about the trustworthiness of the Emperor and with the consideration that if the Emperor did not adhere to the peace, Augsburg would be free to oppose the Emperor again.

[2] Also in 25 points, Frölich explains the reasons why the council of Augsburg should not obey the Emperor, and what problems Augsburg would have if the city came to an understanding with the Emperor like Ulm and other cities.

div.p: Reasons why an honorable council in Augsburg should not oppose the Emperor's Majesty, and what troubles would arise if they did not obey like Ulm and other cities.
Reasons why an honorable council in Augsburg should not obey the Emperor's Majesty in the aforementioned case, and what troubles would arise if they submitted like Ulm and others.
